Evaluations and formal\robservationsare designedtoencouragecommongoalsand tocomplywiththe state’sevaluationcriteriaanddistrict policies.Temporaryand\rprobationary teachers are evaluated annually and tenured teachers are evaluated every other year.\r\rEvaluations are conducted by site administrators
column3: who have been trained and certified for competency to perform teacher evaluations. Evaluation criteria\rincludes the following:\r•Engaging and Supporting all Students in Learning\r•Understanding and Organizing Subject Matter for Student Learning\r•Assessing Student Learning\r•Creating and Maintaining Effective Environments for Student Learning\r•Planning Instruction and Designing Learning Experiences for all Students\r•Developing as a Professional Educator\rEach site has an Academic Common Core Coach to work with staff and students to implement CCSS and improve our instructional practice. Los Robles\rhas participated in Positive Behavior and Instructional Support (PBIS) as an alternative to suspensions and to create a positive and successful learning\ratmosphere for every student.\r\rTeachers have received hands-on practical training through Instructional Rounds
column5: and collaborative efforts at the school\rsite. Administrators conduct regular walk-throughs for data collection to measure the implementation of training received and provide feedback to\rteachers for affirmation and support. Teachers have the opportunity to attend professional conferences and training offered by the Tulare County Office\rof Education for CCSS in math

Evaluations and formal\robservationsare designedtoencouragecommongoalsand tocomplywiththe state’sevaluationcriteriaanddistrict policies.Temporaryand\rprobationary teachers are evaluated annually and tenured teachers are evaluated every other year.\r\rEvaluations are conducted by site administrators
column3: who have been trained and certified for competency to perform teacher evaluations. Evaluation criteria\rincludes the following:\r•Engaging and Supporting all Students in Learning\r•Understanding and Organizing Subject Matter for Student Learning\r•Assessing Student Learning\r•Creating and Maintaining Effective Environments for Student Learning\r•Planning Instruction and Designing Learning Experiences for all Students\r•Developing as a Professional Educator\rEach site has an Academic Common Core Coach to work with staff and students to implement CCSS and improve our instructional practice. Los Robles\rhas participated in Positive Behavior and Instructional Support (PBIS) as an alternative to suspensions and to create a positive and successful learning\ratmosphere for every student.\r\rTeachers have received hands-on practical training through Instructional Rounds
column5: and collaborative efforts at the school\rsite. Administrators conduct regular walk-throughs for data collection to measure the implementation of training received and provide feedback to\rteachers for affirmation and support. Teachers have the opportunity to attend professional conferences and training offered by the Tulare County Office\rof Education for CCSS in math
